document.title: Religion Curriculum 2014 Archdiocese of Seattle Catholic Schools

4DC07FF1C16E46839B16950DF8403DDB.description:
Know that all people belong to God
and there are many different ways to pray to God.

5794DD977E3D4B958F92EC1BE448D1AF.description:
Show God’s love for all people
through words and actions.

FD2B066CCD2D436FA97F7F530D312841.description:
Know that God made all people, and
we are called to respect all people.

B17D624A15C0470B8BE06F8A8350BA76.description:
CALL TO ECUMENISM,
INTERFAITH
DIALOGUE AND THE
NEW
EVANGELIZATION
[848-849, 927-933, 905,
2044,2472]

8C030D9050914AB1B71CF76FCAD4CF43.description:
Participate in and reflect on service and
how we can be Jesus for others.

2D2F5CBD51304290B186C2391D75BAC9.description:
Recognize that our talents are gifts from
God and that we are called to share with others.

01DD5F7078A54F07B60324C8384E16BB.description:
CALL TO
STEWARDSHIP AND
SERVICE: Catholic
Social Teaching about
the common good
[1905-1948, 2419-2422]
Scripture
Mt. 5:3-12

C27FA85D5A7B4E71BC08D8340BE015E8.description:
Recognize that God has a plan for
everyone and provides us with unique gifts to follow the
plan He has for us.

A4BCE75F2C2C4B3C896E4912EF030364.description:
Know that by Baptism we are called to
join in Jesus’ mission.

760FEBA66FF446F2B220D7BDF195D506.description:
BAPTISMAL CALL AND
DISCIPLESHIP (the
mandate to go forth)
[816-849]
Scripture
Mt. 28: 19-20

53D30D711E8942D9B48D611A5E5FA694.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 6 – THE CHURCH’S MISSIONARY LIFE AND SERVICE: Students acquire and demonstrate skills to recognize their gifts from God and their
vocation to share the good News of Jesus Christ in word and deed in the world.

5D544CC00B5E491BA0DD9435BE5296A8.description:
Know that Mary is the Mother of God,
who was chosen by God for this unique role and we
have special days honoring her.

FD1A75B7D1CB4509BF24D7097E486AF1.description:
MARY AS MODEL OF
THE CHURCH
[148-149, 963-975, 2673-
2682]
Scripture
Lk. 1:26-38

2A4D9E3951A54189B83B2183989B8B43.description:
Know the name and story of a favorite
saint.

EA8C618669604BD18569B992B862F722.description:
Know and talk about the patron saint of
the parish.

C12263E326AF404CAC4A7E56A11A09C9.description:
Know that saints are heroes of our faith and
have special days on which the church remembers
(memorial) their holy lives.

D157A5A6B9B44FD6A446E655C334FE92.description:
Distinguish the parish priest’s role from
the role of their parents.

345373046FA7426CBDA2F4310EDAC650.description:
Recognize that God wants everyone to be
holy, because we are all God’s children.

7E3B95E93052466B946BBDF968C4A1A9.description:
The
Universal Call to
Holiness
[2013-2014, 2028, 2813]
Scripture
1 Peter 1:15-16
Leviticus 11:44

9F579845A6B54ED98A094665EB8E3A59.description:
Understand that Jesus’ family prayed
and worshipped together.

2102E6BCE8D14E17A06CB17F601EB276.description:
Associate the Holy Family with Jesus,
Mary, Jesus’ mother, Joseph, Jesus’ father on earth.

9A466CEFBA934ACF8FFCBF9D19B246CB.description:
Recognize that the parish is the place
where God’s people gather to worship and serve others.

36AF19A61ABE439AB2E9DD42D4D26202.description:
Demonstrate awareness of the
importance of attending Mass on Sundays and Holy Days
of Obligation.

3B06BD34AB7C47CF85D05F768B94E53B.description:
Identify a picture of the Archbishop and
name him as the leader of our Archdiocese, the local
Church.

CE3C92473889417DAEE91E947ED9161F.description:
Church Order: The
Hierarchy and
Magisterium and
Infallibility
[874-896]

F421B0FE6E7F43449B1A09AC7CA32FD6.description:
CHRIST’S
FAITHFUL:
HEIRARCHY, LAITY,
CONSECRATED LIFE
[871-945]

253F9487BD004A25A1427A2EFD859823.description:
Know that they belong to the Catholic
Church.

60B39FC1A862442E92E83BB87A015BF6.description: THE MYSTERY AND MARKS OF THE CHURCH: One, Holy, Catholic, Apostolic [811-870]

25427CDA91CF4EDCB7FD257AC9774C29.description:
Begin to understand that the Holy Spirit
lives in each one of us and helps us make good choices.

142C07A1373F4377AC9DD389F45F79F3.description:
Temple of the Holy
Spirit [797-801]
Scripture
1 Cor. 6:19

3C36E72FCD594FB58530BED7001C08E5.description:
Begin to understand and identify the
“Body of Christ” as who we are as we pray together and
serve one another.

36E7236289764EFEBC93A61E3B2348A2.description:
Know that Church is where God’s
children/family comes together each Sunday to give
thanks to God at Mass

E61832DA5D574605AA8357C01CAC0BD0.description:
Understand that the Catholic Church is
the family of God.

EE4BC5806D5D41E2912CC472998455F6.description:
Recall Church as a place where all
people join together to worship, to thank God, to serve
God, and to serve one another.

31834AC1FABE4AF1A746A29DFF4FD8D8.description:
Know why our parish has a special name
and is a part of Church history.

94DE9604CF254A57B44F7FF58F521F40.description:
THE CHURCH IN
GOD’S PLAN [748-780]
Church History
[758-780]

AE6D2E8333234EAB8988A53B812702A1.description: TASK OF CATECHESIS 5 – EDUCATING FOR THE LIFE, COMMUNITY, AND HISTORY OF THE CHURCH: Students study and participate in the life and mission of the church, the Body of Christ and the community of believers, as expressed in the Church’s origin, history, ecclesiology, the Communion of Saints and their family, the domestic church.

E16B72E30EFD4D7ABF8263ECEA36B291.description: Invitation to Liturgy of the Hours

797A97111108459BB5E9CCD1FA914450.description:
Prayers of blessing, adoration, praise,
intercession, thanksgiving, petition

A162C615D582443AAD1B5A32008A937F.description: PRAYERS WE KNOW BY HEART, EXPERIENCE AND SHARE AT MASS

EFF3C519AB9E46EE979983A512B38756.description:
Know that there are prayers that the Church
and families recite/pray together.

6801DDB995584AF5A241CD32FF92542C.description:
DEVOTIONAL
PRACTICES (e.g.
Rosary, Stations of the
Cross, Novenas,
Simbang Gabi, etc.)
[1200-1209,1674-1679,
2683-2696]

78B1FA3451064955A0B7C74D97A1377D.description:
Show understanding that Jesus prayed and
taught his friends to pray the Lord’s Prayer.

9AE8E68CD4F548D89E2733D67397BDE7.description:
OUR FATHER:
SUMMARY OF THE
GOSPEL
[2746-2865]
Scripture:
Mt. 6:9-14
Lk. 1:28, 42, 11: 1-4

EBCA0248E3864B0A941C7351C8C299D9.description:
Talk about different ways to pray: alone, with
classmates, with family.

C0E2A7E3C455477599D0A6645EE8D20E.description:
Identify Church as a special place to pray –
with a community or privately.

2CE4F5E2D17A45A7B7AF0ACEB7238556.description:
Begin the practice of calling on God at all times
and in all places.

426A8B3194C14658BF36D6147F35155F.description:
EXPRESSIONS OF
PRAYER, PROCESS
Personal, Shared,
Vocal, Singing,
Meditation
2700-2724]

FF5A0D3CD0B6416CB92CCE89E5221CF3.description:
Articulate the reasons for prayer and
experience many prayer opportunities.

0CA0D2640649463F9E705425703BD828.description:
Practice giving thanks and asking God for help
through prayer.

E267777155224D6AB8BA6973214F1A50.description:
FORMS OF PRAYER
(Blessing, Adoration
Petition, Intercession
Thanksgiving, Praise)
[2623-2649]

B75D5ECBC9E04FBD8A67AB3E98DF665C.description:
Recall a simple definition of prayer – talking
and listening to God to sustain a relationship with Him.

925EDB8781714172A2A5A79672B586FE.description:
THE UNIVERSAL CALL
TO PRAYER,
IMPORTANCE OF
PRAYER
[2558-2758]
Scripture:
Mt. 6: 5-15

886816348FA44D1895EB69B333E0AC62.description: TASK OF CATECHESIS 4 – TEACHING TO PRAY: Students experience and engage in Catholic expressions of prayer to deepen their relationship with God and the Church.

6118279C7B7A47E885390637EB4F32EA.description:
Participate in and reflect on age
appropriate service projects to help other people.

41725C990A9A4B03951DFFA13D614137.description:
Explain how every person has God-given
rights.

ED3E2BB36C8A4052B05D6C43DE93C823.description:
Articulate ways people are different
from other creatures – living things.

1F3753992ABC4F1BBA3BD2F2896C737A.description:
Understand the care of personal
belongings, classroom, school building, and parish
grounds.

44313304356241B5B2CADFD00BD30660.description:
Explain ways to take care of the gift of
God’s creation.

A243D4853D284E3098945DC13325690E.description:
Catholic Social Teaching –
Consistent Ethic of Life,
Love of Neighbor, and
Corporal and Spiritual
Works of Mercy
[2419-2449]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-18; 2: 1-25

95FB533A941840A9BB057801341C26E8.description:
Understand when we sin through
selfish actions, we hurt ourselves and others.

84F6C99B33A745A2B2438AE86D3215D7.description:
Personal and Social Sin
[1846-1876]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:7-25; 3:1-24
Lk. 15: 11-32

80C7D64560F64E6BBD3FD29CACECB36E.description:
Demonstrate actions that show we have
respect for one another and the God-given rights of
others.

3672B0735F1E46278EA4C9E4666D8C35.description:
Recognize the word virtue as a gift from
God to do good things.

60D3B12A9F5148768B556BD60FFF0615.description:
Virtues Cardinal and
Theological
[1803-1845, 2656-2662]
Scripture
Micah 6:8
Mt. 5: 1-12

7644B7A519204ADB9217A73081F24346.description:
Ten Commandments as ways God
loves us and invites us to stay close to Him and to
one another.

0DEF17335E214774BB43C9A1BCDF87B6.description: Listen to and retell the story of Exodus

5EF7F2A50AC9441E8CBEEB8DB141874D.description:
Covenant and Ten
Commandments
[2052-2557]
Scripture
Ex.2-24
Ex. 19:16-20:17
Mt. 22:34-40
Mk. 10: 17-20
Lk. 10:25-28

6C0727CC155E469A825CFC4BA33EFE10.description:
Know that God gave us guides to help
us know how to live good lives.

F2E9FEEE059D4AEAA0CC07DACF450944.description:
Talk about actions that we know hurt
God, others and ourselves.

6FBC04680B204D4EAB82A7FF36737B34.description:
Understand consequences of our
actions, and develop an awareness of our need to be
sorry when we choose an action that hurts someone
or something. (sin)

634A1CC9CAA14BE5A8F79EA13E642DC1.description:
Know the difference between right and
wrong; name and describe actions that illustrate this
understanding.

95A9C0F7176F46A483E568D96F33865E.description:
Human
Freedom and
Conscience Formation
[1030-1037, 1730-1802]
Scripture
Gen. 6:9-9:17

6F863733B6E74E8EBD2A3F5A555470D5.description:
Recognize that God loves us so much
that human beings are made to love and serve
others.

FC630C43597F47A4A682C3B9C3071443.description: Made for Happiness with God, Beatitudes [1218-1229, 1716-1717] Scripture 2 Cor. 4:4 Mt. 5: 1-12

D37DA6E6A5164117B1E9F2AA06BECF51.description:
Begin to understand that all are made in
the image and likeness of God.

F99B61F44B224191B39AEBFE111F8DC0.description:
Made in the Image of God
– Foundation of Human
Dignity
 [355-368,1004,1700-1876]
Scripture
Gen. 1:1-2:3
Col. 1:15

8C841E4E90B04390A0ABCC459ADEFA54.description:
Begin to understand that God made us to
know, love, and serve Him and others.

584E05FBC56741FBAD93DE64C945B761.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 3: MORAL EDUCATION: Students develop a moral conscience that is informed by Church teachings and conformed to Christ, as modeled in a
personal life of virtue and demonstrated in service of the Gospel’s demands for society.

4387EE0361AD40938115C766485030DD.description:
Experience the use of holy water when
being blessed by the pastor, parents, and teachers.

CAFDF94E52124D979C7BC8CE852C2279.description:
Recognize holy water is used for Church
rites and blessings.

EFC1364F3D4245FF9458357535A97CD2.description:
Liturgical Rites: Weddings,
Funerals and Blessings
[1671-1673]

9C75CC88D1454065B885A09DF53F89DE.description:
Prayerfully list to Psalm 150 and respond
“Praise God!”

75E2CCB6C3934151AED926FD3C0199DB.description:
Divine Office Liturgy of the
Hours
[1174-1178]
Scripture:
Psalms 117, 150, 100

D65C40FADA9F4B139246E3ECE888A3D8.description:
Name and recognize several examples
of sacramentals: holy water, crucifix, holy oil,
tabernacle, sanctuary light, Paschal Candle, Book of
the Gospels, statues of saints, images of Mary,
Stations of the Cross and holy water fonts in the
Church and classroom.

2A3A801D9F6C488797E6A04357C0E376.description:
Know that sacramentals are holy
objects and actions.

AD0F99843491464C929703F0804A7647.description:
Associate the different colors with the
different seasons of the Church year.

A4795C97235144D09F4C8B3B5BD3A379.description:
Celebrate and associate Jesus’ life with
the following: Advent, Christmas, Epiphany, Lent,
Holy Week, Easter and special feasts of Mary and
the saints.

6777D0ECFAC2450D9B3DC7099F5E92EB.description:
Liturgical Calendar
[1163-1173]
Scripture:
Mk. 16:1-8
Lk. 24: 1-53
Jn . 20:1-10

4FBD5B89A43F415ABFD19C80297EEEFC.description:
Understand that God has given us parents
and a pastor with unique roles to show us how to love
others.

79B75146D0854745B883D55BF305B01C.description:
Sacraments at the Service
of Communion
[1533-1666]
Scripture:
Gen. 2:18-24
Mt. 19:4-6; 28:16-20

020693E1D89649B49410CE250E97D371.description:
Know that Jesus loves us and forgives us
always even when we do something wrong.

8F0684C4563143C9AB2121766CB40A13.description:
Sacraments of Healing
[979-987, 1420-1484]
Scripture:
Ps. 32
Mk. 2:1-12

C1B7FE2A76E7498585BAFBBC2274CEB7.description: Share stories about their own baptism.

3F111AB0AF4F46B786DB51DB86B947E0.description:
Hear and recognize the words said at
Baptism: “I baptize you in the name of the Father, and
of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.”

EE342D72E0854642BC8D6EBDEF5CEF59.description:
Identify the Baptismal Font and Paschal
Candle in the parish church.

D069155BE830440E9EDE07BA6E7A796F.description:
Encounter Baptism’s symbols of water,
holy oil, lit candle and the white garment as the
sacramental way people celebrate becoming
members of the church and Christians.

A45FDC3DB71144F5A6E161BE4E4761B2.description:
Begin to understand that each of the seven
Sacraments is celebrated in a special way.

1D7DF91748A44CEF807A5F99793429DC.description:
Begin to relate Sacraments as gifts of grace
that share God’s love for us and bring us closer to
Jesus.

32AFF7F350764A42946C61E3B32874CE.description:
Identify the altar, chalice, tabernacle,
ciborium, pall, priest’s vestments, crucifix, and ambo
in pictures or in person.

102965F356A844F8B5B4E0D68E3C4CCF.description:
Begin to recite grade level Mass responses.
(See Task 4: Teaching to Pray.)

1E97ADE9E5424D65A15DE501176A4FFD.description: Name Sunday as the Lord’s Day.

77E4B425B54F4047B1D3981705C2FE79.description:
Listen to and recognize Jesus’ stories at Mass,
i.e. the Gospel.

92B857065FDA41F3B344366CD215805C.description:
Describe how the community gathers and
remembers the words and actions of Jesus at the Last
Supper.

D2442362DC054B47989245071D56F0D7.description:
Identify the priest by name and that he was
chosen by God to prayerfully lead us as a faith
community.

CD08FC1C3AD348658403952FDF50A2F0.description:
Experience Mass where as a community we
worship and thank God.

B89513B5A2F44D96A12740AD57B34CEE.description:
EUCHARIST
Who, How, When, and
Where the Mass is
Celebrated
[1135-1167,1322-1419]
Scripture:
Mt. 26:25-30
Mk. 14:12-26
Lk. 22:14-20
Jn. 6:32-58
Acts 2:42-47

8D69A7303E2546D1B70B2498B51D3D40.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 2 – LITURGICAL EDUCATION: Students recognize the presence of Christ and enter into communion with Him through active, full and conscious
participation in the Liturgical celebrations and Sacraments of the Church.

DA18D651E6BA4DAB817CCDF802353DE3.description:
Listen to the Creed as the prayer where we
share our belief in God as taught by our Church.

F421E638599D4E6BB7E0E0E8A8C2E961.description:
Begin to understand that sharing our Creed
tells others what we believe.

5244D98D2E4749B1A0D73D6D71390D42.description:
THE CREED: A
Statement of Our Belief
[185-1065]

4641ACEB8C674F40A683C4E13BF3754A.description:
Recognize images of the Holy Spirit, e.g. dove,
wind.

6D49571F219240C5B1A81D4631EBD042.description:
Know that the Holy Spirit lives within us and
gives us the gift of grace.

F8757EF063E94A5396ABF07D66D12DCD.description:
Recognize that God the Holy Spirit is the third
person of the Trinity.

0F48045A5B1C47CABEF0E565A12B11A4.description:
Recognize that God the Son, Jesus Christ, is
the second person of the Trinity.

65798095AE0B48988AE4DC75EACFA1EE.description:
Know that Jesus called God, “Abba” which
means Daddy.

1D240CEB8416483E9EA83793ED793347.description:
Recognize God the Father is the first person of
the Trinity in the Sign of the Cross and that He created
the world, human beings, and all that is good.

831AD31FA27D47DCAB290EA572047BA8.description:
Demonstrate ability and respect for the Sign of
the Cross and the names of the three divine Persons:
God the Father, God the Son (Jesus Christ) and God the
Holy Spirit.

C3F304C10C0D4812AC90520192A4728A.description:
TRINITY:
God the Creator
Jesus the Redeemer,
and Holy Spirit
Sanctifier
[249‐324] Scripture:
Gen. 1:1-31, 2:1-25
Lk 1:26-38; 2:1-20;
2:41-52
Mt. 1:18-2:15; 3:13-1
Mk 14:32-36
Acts 2:1-42

D1D93168E3FB45FFA16AEACDD56A97A2.description:
Recall the stories of Jesus who died on the
Cross for us, rose from the dead, and ascended into
Heaven.

4836D33858ED46DEB2D5EA367AFDBC79.description:
Know that Jesus’ family is called the Holy
Family.

D7D8836E3AD24FC2BE6E5C1FAE9F9C3C.description:
Begin to understand that Jesus is both God
and human.

4706C3DEF4944E87B1941E0409CEC736.description:
Know that Jesus came to live on earth
because He wanted to share God’s love with us.

3DFDDCBEBB564DACB951B0C8410AC64A.description:
Begin to understand the Bible as the book
which contains two parts: Old Testament (prepare us for
Jesus) and the New Testament (about Jesus and the
Church.)

C8576F70630B418F9DFE10CF43CE089F.description:
Salvation History
[50‐73]
Scripture:
Old Testament
New Testament

3D5EA02DD5D34410902446FEB358FC99.description:
Understand the Bible is a holy book and the
story of God’s saving love for us, the Church family.

BA226A2BC666426980D92A8FF987A4EE.description:
Sacred Scripture
[101‐141]
Scripture:
Old Testament
New Testament

A90BE4341D0F417DA2828108D26FD265.description:
Know that angels were created by God to be
his messengers, and that God has given each of us a
Guardian Angel to watch over and protect us.

8A2BB31778974BB2921D68D9BED15A1B.description: Tell in own words the story of creation.

C09C801381C541AD80187A6D53C85087.description:
State that God created everything freely and out
of love for us, and we read about this in the Bible.

4F3E97C65DB347F9A649FFA643B236B9.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 1: KNOWLEDGE OF THE FAITH: Students will explore, profess and reflect on our Catholic faith, which is the content of God’s revelation found in
Sacred Scripture and Sacred Tradition and lived out in the Creed and Church doctrine.
